item.title: Obama and Bourdain dig in
item.description: President Barack Obama took a detour on his Asia trip Monday when he dined with celebrity chef and adventurous eater Anthony Bourdain in Vietnam.
item.ExtractedText:
CNN.com
Anthony Bourdain, Obama dine in Vietnam Updated 0210 GMT (1010 HKT) May 24, 2016 6 photos: Obama visits Vietnam, Japan President Barack Obama, center, accompanies Thi Kim Ngan, center left, chairwoman of Vietnam's National Assembly, at the Presidential Palace in Hanoi, Vietnam, on Monday, May 23. Obama is visiting Vietnam and Japan during his trip to Asia . Hide Caption 1 of 6 6 photos: Obama visits Vietnam, Japan Obama meets with Nguyen Phu Trong, the Vietnamese Communist Party's general secretary, in Hanoi on May 23. Hide Caption 2 of 6 6 photos: Obama visits Vietnam, Japan Obama, with Secretary of State John Kerry and other Cabinet members, attends a meeting with Vietnamese Prime Minister Nguyen Xuan Phuc, third right, in Hanoi on May 23. Hide Caption 3 of 6 6 photos: Obama visits Vietnam, Japan Obama gives a toast during a state luncheon hosted by Vietnam's President in Hanoi on May 23. Hide Caption 4 of 6 6 photos: Obama visits Vietnam, Japan Obama holds a joint press conference with Vietnamese President Tran Dai Quang in Hanoi on May 23. Obama announced the United States is fully lifting the decades-long ban on the sale of military equipment to Vietnam. Hide Caption 5 of 6 6 photos: Obama visits Vietnam, Japan The two presidents listen to their countries' national anthems during a welcoming ceremony at the Presidential Palace in Hanoi on May 23. Hide Caption
